Classes

interface  DataSelector
class  InRange
class  NotMissing

Detailed Description

Given a 2D array of points, reports error measures of assuming linearity.

By passing in different transformations, it is possible to compare potential ways of transforming the data.

Author:
valliappa.lakshmanan

Member Function Documentation

00109         int[] neighSize = new int[]{ 1, 3, 5, 11, 21, 31, 41 };
00110         int[] thresh1 = new int[]{      1,  1,  50,  500,  5000, 50000 };
00111         int[] thresh2 = new int[]{ 500000, 50, 500, 5000, 50000, 500000 };
00112         final String sep = " & ";
00113         System.out.println("D & data range & N & RMSE (raw) & RMSE (log) \\\\ \\hline");
00114         for (int D : neighSize){
00115             for (int i=0; i < thresh1.length; ++i){
00116                 int minval = thresh1[i];
00117                 int maxval = thresh2[i];
00118                 DataSelector selector = new InRange(minval, maxval, popdensity.getMissing());
00119                 // check linearity two ways
00120                 ScalarStatistic logstat = verify(popdensity.getData(), selector, new LogScaling(10), D);        
00121                 ScalarStatistic rawstat = verify(popdensity.getData(), selector, new LinearScaling(100), D);
00122                 System.out.println(D + sep + 
00123                         minval + "-" + maxval + sep +
00124                         rawstat.getNumSamples() + sep + 
00125                         df.format(Math.sqrt(rawstat.getMean())) + sep +
00126                         df.format(Math.sqrt(logstat.getMean())) + " \\\\");         
00127             }
00128             System.out.println("\\hline");
00129         }
00130     }

static ScalarStatistic edu.ou.asgbook.linearity.LinearityVerifier.verify ( int  data[][],
DataSelector  selector,
DataTransform  transform,
int  neighSize 
) [static]

Returns the Mean Square Error statistic. 

00050                                                                                                                      {
00051         // setup
00052         ScalarStatistic errorstat = new ScalarStatistic();
00053         int nrows = data.length;
00054         if ( nrows == 0 ){
00055             return errorstat;
00056         }
00057         int ncols = data[0].length;
00058         if ( ncols == 0 ){
00059             return errorstat;
00060         }
00061         
00062         // find the error in every triad interpolating along rows
00063         for (int col=0; col < ncols; ++col){
00064             for (int row=neighSize; row < nrows-neighSize; ++row){
00065                 if (selector.shouldSelect(data[row][col], data[row-neighSize][col], data[row+neighSize][col])){
00066                     int actualValue = data[row][col];
00067                     double trans0 = transform.transform(data[row-neighSize][col]);
00068                     double trans1 = transform.transform(data[row+neighSize][col]);
00069                     double trans_interp = (trans0 + trans1)/2;
00070                     double interpValue = transform.inverse(trans_interp);
00071                     double error = (interpValue - actualValue);
00072                     errorstat.update(error*error);
00073                 }
00074             }
00075         }
00076         
00077         // repeat for columns
00078         for (int row=0; row < nrows; ++row){
00079             for (int col=neighSize; col < ncols-neighSize; ++col){
00080                 if (selector.shouldSelect(data[row][col], data[row][col-neighSize], data[row][col+neighSize])){
00081                     int actualValue = data[row][col];
00082                     double trans0 = transform.transform(data[row][col-neighSize]);
00083                     double trans1 = transform.transform(data[row][col+neighSize]);
00084                     double trans_interp = (trans0 + trans1)/2;
00085                     double interpValue = transform.inverse(trans_interp);
00086                     double error = (interpValue - actualValue);
00087                     errorstat.update(error*error);
00088                 }
00089             }
00090         }   
00091         
00092         return errorstat;
00093     }
